result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $18 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.  $250 DNA surcharge remitted.

Completion of certified domestic violence treatment.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A Mitchell

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed.  Def entered a plea of guilty on count 1. Court accepted def's plea but w/h adjudication and referred def to FOP. Bail continued.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
Reporter: Melanie Olsen.     Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.

CASH BOND SET AT $250
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Kelsi S.
- Defendant shall not be in the 4700th block of Hayes Rd in Madison, WI.
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $250.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Chelsea E Wetjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
